Certainly! Here are a few more examples of films where the villain's portrayal added to the suspense:

1. "Silence of the Lambs" (1991) - The main villain, Hannibal Lecter (played by Anthony Hopkins), is a brilliant, cannibalistic psychiatrist who speaks in a calm, collected manner that is both mesmerizing and terrifying. His relationship with the protagonist, Agent Clarice Starling (played by Jodie Foster), adds to the tension and suspense as he manipulates her to reveal her personal trauma and fears.

2. "Se7en" (1995) - The main villain, John Doe (played by Kevin Spacey), is a sociopathic serial killer who chooses his victims based on each of the seven deadly sins. His meticulous planning and calculated murders create a sense of dread and horror throughout the film.

3. "No Country for Old Men" (2007) - The main villain, Anton Chigurh (played by Javier Bardem), is a ruthless hitman with a menacing presence and an unusual weapon - a captive bolt pistol. His calm demeanor and unpredictable actions make him a terrifying antagonist who is always one step ahead of the protagonist.

I hope these suggestions are helpful and that you enjoy watching these films!
